author: Staff Reporter
text:
Authorities from the Health Department conducted an inspection in and around the airport on Thursday to check if there were possible for fresh water stagnation that would favour breeding of Aedes mosquito that spreads Zika virus.

The inspection was conducted by a team led by Joint Director (Vector Borne Disease Control) from Chennai, Saravanan, and Deputy Director (DD) of Health Services S. Somasundaram.

The DD said that there were no such breeding pockets. “However, we will screen international patients with symptoms,” he said and added that they have asked the airport authority to create awareness on the virus by distributing pamphlets to the passengers and other stake holders at the airport.
title: Zika: inspection at airport
